output_list.code: function mint(address _x, uint _v) public onlyOwner { balances[_x] += _v; totalSupply += _v; Transfer(0x0, _x, _v); }
output_list.reason: The function mint() is vulnerable to integer overflow. The addition of _v to balances[_x] and totalSupply can cause an overflow if _v is too large. This can be exploited by a malicious user to mint an excessive amount of tokens, potentially leading to a loss of funds or other unintended consequences.

output_list.code: function pricePerWei() public constant returns(uint) { if     (now <  1511799420) return 800.0 * 1 ether; else if(now <  1511885820) return 750.0 * 1 ether; else if(now <  1513181820) return 675.0 * 1 ether; else if(now <  1515514620) return 575.0 * 1 ether; else if(now <  1516205820) return 537.5 * 1 ether; else                                                return 500.0 * 1 ether; }
output_list.reason: The function pricePerWei() is vulnerable to integer overflow. The multiplication of the price with 1 ether can cause an overflow if the price is too large. This can be exploited by a malicious user to manipulate the price, potentially leading to a loss of funds or other unintended consequences.

output_list.code: function foreignBuy(address _investor, uint _unlbValue, string _txHash) external onlyOwner { require(!paused && now >= ICO_START_DATE && now < ICO_END_DATE); require(_unlbValue > 0); unlb.mint(_investor, _unlbValue); ForeignBuy(_investor, _unlbValue, _txHash); }
output_list.reason: The function foreignBuy() is vulnerable to integer overflow. The multiplication of _unlbValue with pricePerWei() can cause an overflow if _unlbValue is too large. This can be exploited by a malicious user to mint an excessive amount of tokens, potentially leading to a loss of funds or other unintended consequences.
